      Holds the traffic type for this SessionOpt
      static byte TRAFFIC_MESSAGES
      Use reliable message-based communication to move data between session endpoints.
      static byte TRAFFIC_RAW_RELIABLE
      Use reliable (e.g., TCP) socket-based communication to move data between session endpoints.
      static byte TRAFFIC_RAW_UNRELIABLE
      Use unreliable (e.g., UDP) socket-based communication to move data between session endpoints.
      static short TRANSPORT_ANY
      Use any available transport to communicate with a given session.
      static short TRANSPORT_BLUETOOTH
      Use only Bluetooth transport to communicate with a given session.
      static short TRANSPORT_IP
      Use any available IP-based transport to communicate with a given session.
      static short TRANSPORT_LAN
      Use only a wired local area network to communicate with a given session.
      static short TRANSPORT_LOCAL
      Use only the local transport to communicate with a given session.
      static short TRANSPORT_NONE
      Use no transport to communicate with a given session.
      static short TRANSPORT_TCP
      Transport using TCP (same as TRANSPORT_WLAN)
      static short TRANSPORT_UDP
      Use only the AllJoyn Reliable Datagram Protocol (flavor of reliable UDP) to communicate with a given session.

      Use only the Wi-Fi Direct transport to communicate with a given session.

      Use only a wireless local area network to communicate with a given session.

      Use only a wireless wide area network to communicate with a given session.
      short transports
      Holds the allowed transports for this SessionOpt

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SessionOpts()
      Construct a new session options class using the most commonly used options: traffic = TRAFFIC_MESSAGES, isMultipoint = false, proximity = PROXIMITY_ANY, transports = TRANSPORT_ANY.
      SessionOpts(byte traffic, boolean isMultipoint, byte proximity, short transports)
      Construct a new session options class using the provided options.

    • Field Detail

      • traffic

        public byte traffic
        Holds the traffic type for this SessionOpt

      • isMultipoint

        public boolean isMultipoint
        Multi-point session capable. A session is multi-point if it can be joined multiple times to form a single session with multi (greater than 2) endpoints. When false, each join attempt creates a new point-to-point session.

      • proximity

        public byte proximity
        Holds the proximity for this SessionOpt

      • transports

        public short transports
        Holds the allowed transports for this SessionOpt

      • TRAFFIC_MESSAGES

        public static final byte TRAFFIC_MESSAGES
        Use reliable message-based communication to move data between session endpoints.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRAFFIC_RAW_UNRELIABLE

        public static final byte TRAFFIC_RAW_UNRELIABLE
        Use unreliable (e.g., UDP) socket-based communication to move data between session endpoints. RAW does not imply raw sockets (that bypass ALL enapsulation possibly down to the MAC level), it implies raw in an AllJoyn sense --MESSAGE encapsulation is not used, but for example UDP + IP + MAC encapsulation is used.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRAFFIC_RAW_RELIABLE

        public static final byte TRAFFIC_RAW_RELIABLE
        Use reliable (e.g., TCP) socket-based communication to move data between session endpoints. RAW does not imply raw sockets (that bypass ALL enapsulation possibly down to the MAC level), it implies raw in an AllJoyn sense --MESSAGE encapsulation is not used, but for example UDP + IP + MAC encapsulation is used.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROXIMITY_ANY

        public static final byte PROXIMITY_ANY
        Do not limit the spatial scope of sessions. This means that sessions may be joined by jointers located anywhere.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROXIMITY_PHYSICAL

        public static final byte PROXIMITY_PHYSICAL
        Limit the spatial scope of sessions to the local host. Interpret as "the same physical machine." This means that sessions may be joined by jointers located only on the same physical machine as the one hosting the session.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROXIMITY_NETWORK

        public static final byte PROXIMITY_NETWORK
        Limit the spatial scope of sessions to anwhere on the local logical network segment. This means that sessions may be joined by jointers located somewhere on the network.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRANSPORT_NONE

        public static final short TRANSPORT_NONE
        Use no transport to communicate with a given session.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRANSPORT_LOCAL

        public static final short TRANSPORT_LOCAL
        Use only the local transport to communicate with a given session.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRANSPORT_BLUETOOTH

        public static final short TRANSPORT_BLUETOOTH
        Use only Bluetooth transport to communicate with a given session.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRANSPORT_WLAN

        public static final short TRANSPORT_WLAN
        Use only a wireless local area network to communicate with a given session.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRANSPORT_TCP

        public static final short TRANSPORT_TCP
        Transport using TCP (same as TRANSPORT_WLAN)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRANSPORT_WWAN

        public static final short TRANSPORT_WWAN
        Use only a wireless wide area network to communicate with a given session.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRANSPORT_LAN

        public static final short TRANSPORT_LAN
        Use only a wired local area network to communicate with a given session.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRANSPORT_WFD

        public static final short TRANSPORT_WFD
        Use only the Wi-Fi Direct transport to communicate with a given session.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRANSPORT_UDP

        public static final short TRANSPORT_UDP
        Use only the AllJoyn Reliable Datagram Protocol (flavor of reliable UDP) to communicate with a given session.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRANSPORT_ANY

        public static final short TRANSPORT_ANY
        Use any available transport to communicate with a given session. It is the case that (1) certain topologies of AllJoyn distributed applications can cause problems when run on Wi-Fi Direct substrate networks; (2) the specifics of authentication in Wi-Fi Direct networks can also produce surprising results in some AllJoyn topologies; and (3) there are implementation problems in existing Wi-Fi Direct systems that prevent certain AllJoyn topologies from forming. Because these issues might produce surprising results in existing applications that are unaware of the limitations, we do no enable Wi-Fi Direct automatically. Selecting ANY transport really means selecting ANY but Wi-Fi Direct. In order to enable discovery over Wi-Fi Direct, and use of the Wi-Fi Direct transport an application author must positively act and OR in the TRANSPORT_WFD bit.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRANSPORT_IP

        public static final short TRANSPORT_IP
        Use any available IP-based transport to communicate with a given session. Selecting the IP transport really implies letting the system decice which transport is best.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • SessionOpts

        public SessionOpts()
        Construct a new session options class using the most commonly used options: traffic = TRAFFIC_MESSAGES, isMultipoint = false, proximity = PROXIMITY_ANY, transports = TRANSPORT_ANY.

      • SessionOpts

        public SessionOpts(byte traffic,
           boolean isMultipoint,
           byte proximity,
           short transports)
        Construct a new session options class using the provided options.
        Parameters:
        traffic - the traffic bitfield values.
        isMultipoint - the isMultipoint option
        proximity - the proximity bitfield values.
        transports - the transports bitfield values.
